intro: Astracantha intermixta, commonly known as the mixed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features small, green leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers that are often surrounded by red bracts. It is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
